info:
## MQTT from the ground up

This work is based on work by [@cymplecy](https://discourse.nodered.org/u/cymplecy/summary) and can be found over at the [Node-RED forum](https://discourse.nodered.org/t/fun-exercise-make-an-mqtt-broker-in-node-red/82229).

The initial commit of this flow is the original flow as found at [google cloud](https://drive.google.com/file/d/1uY-IV8KPYE5W3uL-oc9ozRvwdBHtzpcG/view?usp=sharing).

## Step 1 - Convert Blockly nodes to Function nodes

Erlang-Red does not and probably never will support [Blockly](https://flows.nodered.org/node/node-red-contrib-blockly) since it generates Javascript code.

But since it does display the JS code, I took the code made function nodes out of the code.

This allows me to import the flow into Erlang-Red where I have to convert everything to Erlang.

## Resources

- [MQTT v3.1.1 Standard](https://docs.oasis-open.org/mqtt/mqtt/v3.1.1/os/mqtt-v3.1.1-os.html)
- [Basics to MQTT packet](https://cedalo.com/blog/mqtt-packet-guide/)

                     <<TopicName/bytes, Sep/bytes, PubPayload/bytes>>, green, dot, 5),

%% PubAck packet - keeps publisher happy, port 1
node_helpers:msg_send_on_port(1, Msg#{ <<"payload">> => [<<4:4,0:4,1:8,0:8,0:8>>] }, NodeDef),

%% port 2 goes to the code that sends this packet onto all subscribres
node_helpers:msg_send_on_port(2, Msg#{ <<"topicName">> => TopicName, <<"mqttpayload">> => InPayload }, NodeDef ),

%% Send no other messages
undefined.

%%
%% State machine that stores the subscriptions created by MQTT clients.
%% It just stores a mapping from subscription topic to a collection of 
%% tcp session ids.
%%
-module(store_subscriptions).

-behaviour(gen_statem).

-export([
    start/0,
    init/1,
    callback_mode/0,
    handle_event/4,
    code_change/4,
    terminate/3,
    stop/0
]).

callback_mode() -> handle_event_function.

-define(KEEP_STATE(ReplyWith),
    {keep_state, Store, [{reply, From, ReplyWith}]}
).

%% API.  This example uses a registered name name()
%% and does not link to the caller.
start() ->
    gen_statem:start({local, ?MODULE}, ?MODULE, [], []).

init([]) ->
    State = storing,
    Data = #{subscriptions => []},
    {ok, State, Data}.

%% Mandatory callback functions
stop() ->
    gen_statem:stop(?MODULE).
terminate(_Reason, _State, _Data) ->
    void.
code_change(_Vsn, State, Data, _Extra) ->
    {ok,State,Data}.

%%
%% handler function for state transistions
%%


%%
%% ------------- Initiated actions
%%
%% Connection initiated and state is disconnected --> allow connection and
%% store the SessionId associated with connection and move to state "connected".
handle_event(
  {call, From},
  {<<"subscribe">>, [SessionId, Topic]},
  storing,
  #{ subscriptions := Subscriptions } = OldStore
) ->
    Store = case lists:keyfind({Topic, SessionId}, 4, Subscriptions) of
        false ->
            #{ subscriptions => [{sub, Topic, SessionId, {Topic, SessionId}} | Subscriptions]};
        _ ->
            OldStore
    end,
    ?KEEP_STATE(<<"ok">>);

%% Connection being initiated but state is already connected however SessionIds
%% match so this is re-initiating the same connection --> ok
handle_event(
  {call, From},
  {<<"unsubscribe">>, [SessionId, Topic]},
  storing,
  #{ subscriptions := Subscriptions }
) ->
    Store = #{ subscriptions => lists:keydelete({Topic, SessionId}, 4, Subscriptions) },
    ?KEEP_STATE(<<"ok">>);

handle_event(
  {call, From},
  {<<"subscriptions">>, _},
  storing,
  #{ subscriptions := Subscriptions } = Store
) ->
    ?KEEP_STATE([{T,S} || {sub, T,S, {T,S}} <- Subscriptions]);

handle_event(
  {call, From},
  {<<"clear">>, _},
  storing,
  #{ subscriptions := Subscriptions }
) ->
    Store = #{ subscriptions => [] },
    ?KEEP_STATE(<<"ok">>);

handle_event(
  {call, From},
  {<<"unsubscribe_session_id">>, SessionId},
  storing,
  #{ subscriptions := Subscriptions }
) ->
    Store = #{ subscriptions =>  delete_all_subscriptions_for_session(SessionId, Subscriptions)},
    ?KEEP_STATE(<<"ok">>);

handle_event(
  {call, From},
  {<<"unsubscribe_all_from_topic">>, Topic},
  storing,
  #{ subscriptions := Subscriptions }
) ->
    Store = #{ subscriptions =>  delete_all_topic_subscribers(Topic, Subscriptions) },
    ?KEEP_STATE(<<"ok">>);

handle_event(
  {call, From},
  {<<"subs_for_topic">>, Topic},
  storing,
  #{ subscriptions := Subscriptions } = Store
) ->
    ?KEEP_STATE([S || {sub, T,S, {T,S}} <- subs_for_topic(Topic, Subscriptions, [])]);

%%
%% Fall through.
handle_event({call, From} = EventType, Stiff, State, Store) ->
    io:format("TEST (call): ~p ~p ~p ~p~n",[EventType, Stiff, State, Store]),
    ?KEEP_STATE(<<"not_allowed">>);

handle_event(EventType, Stiff, State, Store) ->
    io:format("TEST : ~p ~p ~p ~p~n",[EventType, Stiff, State, Store]),
    {keep_state, Store}.


%%
%% Helpers
subs_for_topic(Topic, Subscriptions, Acc) ->
    case lists:keytake(Topic, 2, Subscriptions) of
        false ->
            Acc;
        {value, Sub, NewList} ->
            subs_for_topic(Topic, NewList, [Sub | Acc])
    end.

delete_all_topic_subscribers(Topic, Subscriptions) ->
    case lists:keytake(Topic, 2, Subscriptions) of
        false ->
            Subscriptions;
        {value, _, NewList} ->
            delete_all_topic_subscribers(Topic, NewList)
    end.

%%
%%
delete_all_subscriptions_for_session(SessionId, Subscriptions) ->
    case lists:keytake(SessionId, 3, Subscriptions) of
        false ->
            Subscriptions;
        {value, _, NewList} ->
            delete_all_subscriptions_for_session(SessionId, NewList)
    end.

-module(node_helpers).

-import(ered_nodered_comm, [
    send_out_debug_msg/4,
    node_status/5,
    node_status_clear/2,
    post_exception_or_debug/3
]).

-import(ered_messages, [
    set_prop_value/3
]).

-import(ered_nodes, [
    send_msg_to_connected_nodes/2,
    send_msg_on/2
]).

%%
%% Node helpers, things that affect what the state of the node 
-export([
    status/5,
    status_with_clear/6,
    exception/3,
    debug/4,
    unsupported/3
]).

%%
%% Message helpers to help updating content on the message map
-export([
   msg_update/3,
   msg_send/2,
   msg_send_on_port/3
]).

%%
%% Sends the message out on a specific port.
%% If a function happens to have multiple ports, then
%% use this to send a message out on exactly one of those
%% ports. 
%% Ports are 1-based, i.e. they start at 1 and increase by
%% one.
-spec msg_send_on_port(
        Port :: 0..65322,
        Msg:: map(),
        NodeDef :: map()
) -> any() | none().
msg_send_on_port(_, _, #{ <<"wires">> := [] } ) ->
    ignore;
msg_send_on_port(1, Msg, #{ <<"wires">> := [SetOfWires | _RestWires] }) ->
    send_msg_on(SetOfWires, Msg);
msg_send_on_port(Port, Msg, #{ <<"wires">> := [_SetOfWires | RestWires] }) when Port > 1 ->
    msg_send_on_wires(Msg, RestWires, Port - 1);
msg_send_on_port(_, _, _)  ->
    ignore.

msg_send_on_wires(_, [], _) ->
    ignore;
msg_send_on_wires(Msg, [SetOfWires | _RestWires], 1) ->
    send_msg_on(SetOfWires, Msg);
msg_send_on_wires(Msg, [_SetOfWires | RestWires], Port) ->
    msg_send_on_wires(Msg, RestWires, Port - 1).

%%
%% Send out a message to all nodes connected this this node.
%% A function node can then either return the message and the 
%% message will be sent again or it returns the atom `undefined` and
%% nothing happens. Because it has already sent the messages.
-spec msg_send(
        Msg :: map(),
        NodeDef :: map()
) -> any() | none().
msg_send(Msg, NodeDef) ->
    send_msg_to_connected_nodes(NodeDef, Msg).
    
%%
%% Update a value in the msg, creating nested maps and lists as needed.
%% Property is defined in `key.dot.sq[number]` form, i.e., whatever Node-RED
%% supports, this can too.
-spec msg_update(
        Msg :: map(),
        PropName :: string(),
        Value :: any() 
) -> map().
msg_update( Msg, PropName, Value ) ->
    set_prop_value(PropName, Value, Msg).

%%
%% Add a node status: 
-spec status( 
       Msg :: map(),
       NodeDef :: map(),
       Txt :: binary(),
       Clr :: 'grey' | 'yellow' | 'blue' | 'red' | 'green',
       Shp :: 'ring' | 'dot' 
) -> Msg :: map().
status(#{'_ws' := WsName} = Msg, NodeDef, Txt, Clr, Shp) ->
    node_status(WsName, NodeDef, Txt, atom_to_binary(Clr), atom_to_binary(Shp)),
    Msg.

%%
%% show status and then clear it again after Timeout seconds
-spec status_with_clear( 
       Msg :: map(),
       NodeDef :: map(),
       Txt :: binary(),
       Clr :: 'grey' | 'yellow' | 'blue' | 'red' | 'green',
       Shp :: 'ring' | 'dot',
       Timeout :: integer()
) -> Msg :: map().
status_with_clear(#{'_ws' := WsName} = Msg, NodeDef, Txt, Clr, Shp, Timeout) ->
    node_status(WsName, NodeDef, Txt, atom_to_binary(Clr), atom_to_binary(Shp)),
    timer:apply_after(Timeout * 1000, fun() -> node_status_clear(WsName, NodeDef) end),
    Msg.

%%
%% Raise an exception that can be caught by a 
%% catch node.
-spec exception(
        Msg :: map(),
        NodeDef :: map(),
        ErrorMsg :: binary()
) -> Msg :: map().
exception(Msg, NodeDef, ErrorMsg) ->
    post_exception_or_debug(NodeDef, Msg, ErrorMsg),
    Msg.

%%
%% Post a debug message to the debug panel
-spec debug(
        Msg :: map(),
        NodeDef :: map(),
        ErrorMsg :: binary(),
        ErrorType :: 'error' | 'warning' | 'notice' | 'normal'
) -> Msg :: map().
debug(Msg, NodeDef, ErrorMsg, ErrorType) ->
    send_out_debug_msg(NodeDef, Msg, ErrorMsg, ErrorType),
    Msg.

%%
%% Unsupported message, advices the user that something is not
%% supported by the implementation. This will generate a mesage
%% in the debug panel to raise the issue with the user.
-spec unsupported(
        Msg :: map(),
        NodeDef :: map(),
        ErrorMsg :: binary()
) -> Msg :: map().
unsupported(Msg, NodeDef, ErrorMsg) ->
    ered_nodered_comm:unsupported(NodeDef, Msg, ErrorMsg),
    Msg.

-module(show_subscription_details).

-import(node_helpers, [
    status/5
]).

-export([show/2]).

show(#{ <<"payload">> := [] } = Msg, NodeDef) ->
    status(Msg, NodeDef, "no subscriptions", grey, ring);

show(#{ <<"payload">> := Lst, '_ws' := WsName} = Msg, NodeDef) ->
    status(Msg, NodeDef, list_to_binary(io_lib:format("~p",[Lst])), green, dot).

name: create subscribe payload
func:
%%
%% WARNING: This code assumes a single topic that is successfully subscribed to.
%%

#{ <<"payload">> := InPayload } = Msg,

{RemLength, VarHeaderAndPubPayload} = mqtt_packet_helpers:remlength(InPayload),

{PacketIdentifier, Topics} = mqtt_packet_helpers:packetidentifier(VarHeaderAndPubPayload),

%% create the acknowledge packet and send it back
%% NOTE: the last zero is the success status of the subscription: successful for QoS 0.
M = Msg#{ 
     <<"payload">> => <<9:4, 0:4, 2:8, PacketIdentifier:16/bits, 0:8>>
},

node_helpers:msg_send_on_port(1, M, NodeDef),

{ok, TopicName, _} = mqtt_packet_helpers:poptopic(Topics),

node_helpers:status_with_clear(Msg, NodeDef, TopicName, green, ring, 5),

%% create the details for updating the subscription list.
Msg2 = node_helpers:msg_update(M, "mqttPacket.subscribe", #{ 
   <<"MessageId">> => PacketIdentifier,
   <<"topicName">> => TopicName
}),

node_helpers:msg_send_on_port(2, Msg2, NodeDef),

%% Send no message, they have been sent.
undefined

-module(mqtt_packet_helpers).

-export([
    control/1, 
    controlbyte/1,
    remlength/1,
    topicname/1,
    packetidentifier/1,
    poptopic/1,
    iterate_through_topics/2
]).

controlbyte(#{ <<"payload">> := Payload}) ->
    control(Payload).

control([]) ->
    #{};

control(V) when is_list(V) ->
    control( list_to_binary(V));
%%
%% publish
control(<<3:4, Dup:1/bits, QoS:2/bits, Retain:1/bits, _/bytes>>) ->
    #{ <<"controlbyte">> => 3, 
       <<"flags">>       => binary:decode_unsigned(<<0:4,Dup:1/bits, QoS:2/bits, Retain:1/bits>>),
       <<"qos">>         => binary:decode_unsigned(<<0:6,QoS:2/bits>>),
       <<"duplicate">>   => binary:decode_unsigned(<<0:7,Dup:1/bits>>),
       <<"retain">>      => binary:decode_unsigned(<<0:7,Retain:1/bits>>)
    };

control(<<Control:4/bits, Flag:4/bits, _/bytes>>) ->
    #{ <<"controlbyte">> => binary:decode_unsigned(<<0:4,Control:4/bits>>), 
       <<"flags">> =>  binary:decode_unsigned(<<0:4,Flag:4/bits>>) }.

%%
%% extract the remaining length from a packet and return the
%% rest of the packet.
%% Remaining length has a funky encoding ... so this is a non-trivial 
%% activity.
remlength(V) when is_list(V) ->
    remlength(list_to_binary(V));
    
remlength(<<_:8/bits, 1:1, Len:7/bits, 1:1, Len2:7/bits, 1:1, Len3:7/bits, 0:1, Len4:7/bits, Rest/bytes>>) ->
    {len_to_int(Len)  + (len_to_int(Len2) * 128) + (len_to_int(Len3) * 128 * 128) + (len_to_int(Len4) * 128 * 128 * 128), Rest};

remlength(<<_:8/bits, 1:1, Len:7/bits, 1:1, Len2:7/bits, 0:1, Len3:7/bits, Rest/bytes>>) ->
    {len_to_int(Len)  + (len_to_int(Len2) * 128) + (len_to_int(Len3) * 128 * 128), Rest};

remlength(<<_:8/bits, 1:1, Len:7/bits, 0:1, Len2:7/bits, Rest/bytes>>) ->
    {len_to_int(Len)  + (len_to_int(Len2) * 128), Rest};

remlength(<<_:8/bits, 0:1, Len:7/bits, Rest/bytes>>) ->    
    {len_to_int(Len), Rest}.


%%
%% Retrieve the topic name from the variable length header
topicname(V) when is_list(V) ->
    topicname(list_to_binary(V));

topicname(<<MSB:1/bytes, LSB:1/bytes, Rest/bytes>>) ->
    TotalLen = (binary:decode_unsigned(<<MSB:1/bytes>>) bsl 8) + binary:decode_unsigned(<<LSB:1/bytes>>),
    <<TopicName:TotalLen/bytes, FinalRest/bytes>> = Rest,
    {TopicName, FinalRest}.

%%
%% packet identifier in the variable header
packetidentifier(V) when is_list(V) -> 
    packetidentifier(list_to_binary(V));
packetidentifier(<<MSB:8/bits, LSB:8/bits, Rest/bytes>>) ->
    {<<MSB:1/bytes,LSB:1/bytes>>, Rest}.

%%
%% remove one topic from the list of topics
poptopic(V) when is_list(V) -> 
    poptopic(list_to_binary(V));
poptopic(<<>>) ->
    {done, <<>>};
poptopic(<<MSB:1/bytes, LSB:1/bytes, Rest/bytes>>) ->
    Len = (binary:decode_unsigned(<<MSB:1/bytes>>) bsl 8) + binary:decode_unsigned(<<LSB:1/bytes>>),
    <<TopicName:Len/bytes, NextTopics/bytes>> = Rest,
    {ok, TopicName, NextTopics}.

iterate_through_topics(Topics, Fun) ->
    itt(poptopic(Topics), Fun).

itt({done, _}, _) ->
    done;
itt({ok, TopicName, Rest}, Fun) ->
    Fun(TopicName),
    itt(poptopic(Rest), Fun).

%%
%%
len_to_int(Len) ->
    binary:decode_unsigned(<<0:1,Len:7/bits>>).

name: ack & prepare sub deletion
func:
#{ <<"payload">> := InPayload } = Msg,

{RemLength, VarHeaderAndPubPayload} = mqtt_packet_helpers:remlength(InPayload),

{PacketIdentifier, Topics} = mqtt_packet_helpers:packetidentifier(VarHeaderAndPubPayload),

%% 0b1011 ==> 11 --> UnsubAck
node_helpers:msg_send_on_port(1, Msg#{ <<"payload">> => <<11:4,0:4,2:8,PacketIdentifier:16/bits>> }, NodeDef),

TopicHandler = fun(TopicName) -> 
  node_helpers:status_with_clear(Msg, NodeDef, TopicName, green, ring, 5),
  node_helpers:msg_send_on_port(2, Msg#{<<"payload">> => TopicName}, NodeDef)
end,

mqtt_packet_helpers:iterate_through_topics(Topics, TopicHandler),

%% Send no messages
undefined
